question: Which piece of information can be obtained from the AAA configuration shown?
options: The authentication method list used by the console port is named ACCESS
The local database is checked first when console and Telnet access is authenticated
The authentication method list used for Telnet is named ACCESS
If the TACACS+ server is unavailable, no Telnet sessions can be established
correct_answers: The authentication method list used for Telnet is named ACCESS

question: Which IPv6 First-Hop Security feature can block IPv6 traffic if the traffic is from an unknown origin?
options: IPv6 ND inspection/snooping
Source Guard
RA Guard
DHCPv6 Guard

question: An SNMP manager is unable to change configuration variables on the R1 SNMP agent. What could be the problem?
options: Incorrect SNMP community string
SNMP agent is not configured for write access
ACL is blocking SNMP traffic
SNMP version mismatch
correct_answers: SNMP agent is not configured for write access

question: Customer enabled CoPP. Based on the configuration, which two actions will occur?
options: ICMP packets will be policed at 10 pps with exceed action to drop
All SSH packets will be dropped
All Telnet packets will be dropped
All Telnet packets will be allowed but policed
correct_answers: ICMP packets will be policed at 10 pps with exceed action to drop
All Telnet packets will be dropped

question: Refer to the exhibit. An SNMP manager is unable to change configuration variables on the R1 SNMP agent. What could be the problem?
options: The SNMP community string is incorrect
The SNMP agent is not configured for write access
The ACL applied on the interface is blocking SNMP traffic
SNMP version mismatch between manager and agent
correct_answers: The SNMP agent is not configured for write access

question: Customer enabled CoPP on router R1 based on the configuration below. Which two (2) actions will result from applying this policy?
options: ICMP packets will be policed at 10 pps with exceed action drop
All Telnet packets will be dropped
SSH packets will be policed at 8000 kbps
Only Telnet packets from 192.168.1.1 will be permitted
correct_answers: ICMP packets will be policed at 10 pps with exceed action drop
All Telnet packets will be dropped

question: An administrative user attempts to telnet from R2 to R1 using IP 10.10.10.1 but access is denied. What conclusion can be drawn?
options: The password was mistyped
R1 is blocking Telnet traffic globally
VTY lines must be configured with the 'login authentication ACCESS' command
The access-class command is misconfigured

question: Customer configures uRPF on a Cisco router interface with the 'ip verify unicast source reachable-via rx allow-default' command to eliminate spoofed IP packets. Which conclusion can be drawn?
options: All packets must arrive on the best return-path interface
uRPF strict mode is applied, and a default route may satisfy return-path requirements
uRPF loose mode is applied, requiring at least one matching route
Packets without TCP flags are dropped
correct_answers: uRPF strict mode is applied, and a default route may satisfy return-path requirements

question: Customer enabled the CoPP policy. Which statement is true when this policy is applied?
options: Host 192.168.1.1 will forward Telnet packets to the control plane and will not be policed
Telnet packets from unknown hosts will be permitted
SSH traffic will be dropped
The ACL deny statement overrides class-map matching
correct_answers: Host 192.168.1.1 will forward Telnet packets to the control plane and will not be policed
